name: Naloxone Hydrochloride
indications: naloxone hydrochloride nasal spray indicated emergency treatment known suspected opioid overdose , manifested respiratory and/or central nervous system depression . naloxone hydrochloride nasal spray intended immediate emergency therapy settings opioids may present . naloxone hydrochloride nasal spray substitute emergency medical care .
contraindications: naloxone hydrochloride nasal spray intranasal . ( 2.1 ) seek emergency medical care immediately . ( 2.1 ) single spray naloxone hydrochloride nasal spray intranasally one nostril . ( 2.2 ) administer additional doses naloxone hydrochloride nasal spray , using new nasal spray dose , patient respond responds relapses respiratory depression , additional doses naloxone hydrochloride nasal spray may given every 2 3 minutes emergency medical assistance arrives . ( 2.2 ) additional supportive and/or resuscitative measures may helpful awaiting emergency medical assistance . ( 2.2 )
adverseReactions: naloxone hydrochloride nasal spray contraindicated patients known hypersensitive naloxone hydrochloride ingredients .
indications_original:
Naloxone hydrochloride nasal spray is indicated for the emergency treatment of known or suspected opioid overdose, as manifested by respiratory and/or central nervous system depression.
                  Naloxone hydrochloride nasal spray is intended for immediate administration as emergency therapy in settings where opioids may be present.
                  Naloxone hydrochloride nasal spray is not a substitute for emergency medical care.
contraindications_original: Naloxone hydrochloride nasal spray is for intranasal use only. ( 2.1 ) Seek emergency medical care immediately after use. ( 2.1 ) Administration of a single spray of naloxone hydrochloride nasal spray intranasally into one nostril. ( 2.2 ) Administer additional doses of naloxone hydrochloride nasal spray, using a new nasal spray with each dose, if the patient does not respond or responds and then relapses into respiratory depression, additional doses of naloxone hydrochloride nasal spray may be given every 2 to 3 minutes until emergency medical assistance arrives. ( 2.2 ) Additional supportive and/or resuscitative measures may be helpful while awaiting emergency medical assistance. ( 2.2 )
adverseReactions_original: Naloxone hydrochloride nasal spray is contraindicated in patients known to be hypersensitive to naloxone hydrochloride or to any of the other ingredients.
